org.sbml.jsbml.ext.render.director

Interface SBGNArc<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The concrete datatype for a particular implementation of this arc.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Catalysis<T>, Consumption<T>, Inhibition<T>, Modulation<T>, NecessaryStimulation<T>, Production<T>, ReversibleConsumption<T>, Stimulation<T>

    public interface SBGNArc<T>
    interface for the different types of connecting arcs
    • consumption
    • reversible consumption
    • production
    • catalysis
    • inhibition
    Since:
    1.4
    Author:
    Mirjam Gutekunst

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T draw(Curve curve)
      Draw a whole curve consisting of multiple curve segments.
      T draw(Curve curve, double lineWidth)
      Draw a whole curve consisting of multiple curve segments with the given line width.
      T draw(CurveSegment curveSegment, double lineWidth)
      Method for drawing the connecting arc, with appropriate line ending and the given line width

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        T draw(CurveSegment curveSegment,
       double lineWidth)
        Method for drawing the connecting arc, with appropriate line ending and the given line width
        Parameters:
        curveSegment - a CurveSegment of the Curve of the SpeciesReferenceGlyph
        lineWidth - the width of the curve on the screen.
        Returns:
        T as a graphical representation of any form

      • draw

        T draw(Curve curve,
       double lineWidth)
        Draw a whole curve consisting of multiple curve segments with the given line width.
        Parameters:
        curve - the Curve to draw
        lineWidth - the width of the curve on the screen.
        Returns:
        T graphical representation of the curve
